raw_response:
Thought: To check if a number is prime, we need to see if it has any divisors other than 1 and itself. We can do this by iterating from 2 up to the square root of the number and checking if any numbers divide evenly into it. If none do, then the number is prime.
```ruby
def is_prime?(num)
  return false if num <= 1

  (2..Math.sqrt(num)).none? { |i| num % i == 0 }
end

final_answer(answer: "The is_prime? function checks if a number is prime by iterating from 2 up to the square root of the number and seeing if any divide evenly into it. If none do, then the boolean true is returned.")
```
